title: What are the goals with the PBE changes on Shy
body: Specifically the ap ratios. Is this an attempt  to make guinsoo's a more efficient buy? Or are there other options that this is supposed to open up?

replies.body: It's more just that if you decide to buy Guinsoo's or Gunblade or any other item with AP, you shouldn't feel quite as punished.
Is there a reason why that reasoning doesn't apply to all champs that currently lack any ap ratios?
Indeed, there is one :) Shyvana is already an hybrid-damage dealer, she deals roughly half physical/half magic, even without building AP.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ZOngzAI,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-12T23:53:28.689+0000)
>
> It's more just that if you decide to buy Guinsoo's or Gunblade or any other item with AP, you shouldn't feel quite as punished.

What business does Shyvana have buying either item? Gunblade being ill-fit on her is obvious, but Guinsoo's is too expensive for a pure damage item on a jungler's income.

If you itemize poorly you *should* be punished for it.

> [{quoted}](name=Raxistaicho,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ZOngzAI,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-05-12T23:55:57.495+0000)
>
> What business does Shyvana have buying either item? Gunblade being ill-fit on her is obvious, but Guinsoo's is too expensive for a pure damage item on a jungler's income.
> 
> If you itemize poorly you *should* be punished for it.

Shyvana was a wealth of mixed damage.  Her W on-hit and E on-hit are both magic and contribute a lot to her threat.  She has magic damage that scales with AD.  Is that not hybrid-enough for you?  And that's not even taking the ranged target slow it has on it, helping to relieve one of Shyv's largest downfalls of never being sticky enough.

And if you can't tell why Guinsoo's would be attractive on Shyv, I don't even know.

I already explained why Guinsoo's is not attractive to her, but I'll go a step further and say that if the enemy team allows you to get six hits on them in a team fight you're either punching a tank or your target is so hopeless unable to kite that you didn't need Guinsoo's to kill them in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=Raxistaicho,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5ZOngzAI,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2016-05-13T00:07:02.896+0000)
>
> I already explained why Guinsoo's is not attractive to her, but I'll go a step further and say that if the enemy team allows you to get six hits on them in a team fight you're either punching a tank or your target is so hopeless unable to kite that you didn't need Guinsoo's to kill them in the first place.

You don't need to stack it against champs; minions, monsters, and turrets will build them as well.  This means contesting a Baron or Dragon against Shyvana with a Guinsoo's could mean a world of hurt for you.  And who knows, maybe Shyvana's will run with Cinderhulk jungle enchant and Guinsoo's as the offensive item as opposed to Bloodrazer and tank build sometime in the future as a more late game oriented build.

Even if you do end up smacking a tank, you'll hit a large powerspike and would be a considerable threat (much more than normal) afterwards.  And who cares if you kill one targer, there are generally 5 total.  The additional AP ratios Shyv is getting will also help compensate for Rageblade's down time.  

It can also make her a much more potent split pusher - who wants to go against a Rageblade stacked Shyv?  

Who knows, it might even allow Shyv to lane again by providing her an avenue with a lategame power spike.

I'm not saying it'll be an automatic buy on her, but it does certainly add more options for her and I don't think it should be dismissed easily.

You don't even play SR, so I don't know why you feel you're qualified to make any statement on game balance. Go back to playing ARAM where balance doesn't matter. Rageblade is garbage on Shyvana. There's no reason for her to ever build it, even when snowballing.

Thank you for the answer. With her mixed damage I can see the logic in offering some alternate build paths. It even opens up the option of using {{item:1402}} on her. Although I think {{item:1416}} will be stronger in most situations after the patch hits. Is this an attempt to bring her back to being a potential laner, or are these ideas geared towards making her jungle more healthy?
Why not just kill the AP ratios altogether?  Shyvana has never really been an AP champ.  If she builds damage items, it is things like hydra, bork, or bloodrazor.

Actually, Hextech Gunblade is a rather interesting item on Shyvana, imo.

- The on-demand slow gives you closing/sticking power.
- AP and AD fuel the damage of your abilities
- Shyvana deals SO MUCH DAMAGE, turning 15/5% of that damage into health gives her a lot more uptime

Remember, Shyvana also gets an Armor/MR steroid, making both flat health and health regen effects more potent for her. With Gunblade, all your on-hit damage (from Fervor, W and E) heals you for 15%, while incidential AoE damage (Sunfire Aura, W) heals you for 5%.

I don't know if you already played back then, but in S2, after the rework of Twisted Treeline, Shyvana was one of the champions who broke the old Lord van Damm's Pillager - which gave just 15% Spellvamp. Gunblade now gives essentially 15% Lifesteal, 15% Spellvamp and 15% health back from on-hit effects.
